Event: Aecon begins an estimated 140,000 working hours, with 150 workers in effort to install two turbines.
Atlantic Towing Limited of Dartmouth, Nova Scotia has secured a contract to provide marine tug and barge services to the Cape Sharp Tidal project
Link: Wireless News. (2015). Cape Sharp Tidal Taps Atlantic Towing for Marine Operations Contract. Retrieved from

Event: First Tidal Interconnection cables installed, first project milestone.
Link: Wireless News. (2015). Cape Sharp Tidal Completes 2 Milestone Operations. Retrieved from

Event: Deployment barge ready - milestone two of project and preparing for deployment.
Link: International Water Power and Dam Construction. (2016). Milestone achievements for Cape Sharp Tidal. Retrieved from

Event: Deployment halted due community concern and engagement from owners.
Link: Chronicle-Herald. (2016). Fundy turbine launch halted; Cape Sharp plans to hold consultation on tidal tests. Retrieved from

Event: Tidal power from the project hits the grid. From the deployment Nov 7th
Link: Chronicle-Herald. (2016). Cape Sharp Tidal power hit the grid. Retrieved from

Event: Judge dismissed an application to review the decision that approved the turbine installation in the Bay of Fundy in the first place.
Link: Desveaux, H. (2017). Judge backs Cape Sharp tidal power. Retrieved from

Event: Cape Sharp tidal misses its window to remove the turbines.
Link: Desveaux, H. (2017). Cape Sharp on recovery mission. Retrieved from

Event: Cape Sharp Tidal was able to recover the turbines and decided to scrap testing in St. Marys Bay
Link: Chronicle-Herald. (2017). Cape Sharp axes test in St. Mary's Bay. Retrieved from

Event: The parent company of Nova Scotia Power told OpenHydro and its provisional liquidator that it is withdrawing from its involvement in Cape Sharp Tidal.
Link: Beswick, A. (2018). Emera drops Cape Sharp. Retrieved from

Event: The Cape Sharp Tidal turbine spinning in the Bay of Fundy is now being remotely monitored, more than a month after the project was suspended when Paris-based Naval Energies pulled its funding.
Link: The Canadian Press. (2018). Cape Sharp Tidal Turbine in Bay of Fundy being monitored remotely: Emera. Retrieved from

Event: Team brought into Cape Sharp Tidal turbine in the Bay of Fundy is trying to determine why the machine's rotor is not turning.
Link: The Canadian Press. (2018). Team Investigating why rotor not turning on Cape Sharp tidal turbine. Retrieved from

Event: The Nova Scotia government has ordered the removal of a massive tidal turbine from the bottom of the Bay of Fundy after revoking the company's licence.
Link: The Globe and Mail. (2019). Nova Scotia Government To End Cape Sharp Tidal Turbine Project.
